metadata.title: CVE-2013-4324 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
spice-gtk 0.14, and possibly other versions, invokes the polkit authorityusing the insecure polkit_unix_process_new API function, which allows localusers to bypass intended access restrictions by leveraging aPolkitUnixProcess PolkitSubject race condition via a (1) setuid process or(2) pkexec process, a related issue to CVE-2013-4288.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4324` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-spice-client-glib-2.0 - 0.22-0nocent2
gir1.2-spice-client-gtk-2.0 - 0.22-0nocent2
gir1.2-spice-client-gtk-3.0 - 0.22-0nocent2
libspice-client-glib-2.0-8 - 0.22-0nocent2
libspice-client-gtk-2.0-4 - 0.22-0nocent2
libspice-client-gtk-3.0-4 - 0.22-0nocent2
python-spice-client-gtk - 0.22-0nocent2
spice-client-glib-usb-acl-helper - 0.22-0nocent2
spice-client-gtk - 0.22-0nocent2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice-gtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.22-0nocent2').
